page.title: 04R.A.F.MARTLESHAM 1939-1963.
page.content: The outbreak of hostilities during September,l939, brought about a change in Martlesham's role, as the experimental unit, the A.& A.E.E. moved away to Boscombe down in Hampshire, where it resides to this very day. Fighter squadrons moved onto the Heath and the station took active part in the Battle of Britain and once again names of note served at Martlesham - Bader - Stamford-Tuck and Townsend to name but a few. During the Summer of 1943,units of the United States Air Force moved onto the airfield and their Thunderbolt and Mustang fighters remained there until the Armistice. Experimental flying was conducted on a limited scale post-war but the station was gradually run down until it finally closed as an R.A.F . establishment during l963.
